intro: Paraeremostachys phlomoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional herbal medicine.
